name: Gallery Hotel Art

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Along the Ponte Vecchio, a modern and charming hotel. Spacious and comfortable rooms. Bathroom excellent. Staff are helpful and very courteous.
reviews.title: Charming hotel at a great location

reviews.text: After travelling from NC, landing, taking the train from Rome to Florence, and then a short transfer ride (15 mins) arriving here was magnificent. The staff was so warm and friendly and welcoming. We knew we had "arrived"! Hotel rooms are spotless, and spacious...complete with a comfy rollaway bed made with the best linens for our 7 year old daughter. The food in the Asian fusion restaurnat was great with an Italian flair, and the breakfast was more than anyone could want. Location...perfect...steps away from Pontevecchio, and their sister hotel Continental is 15 steps away with a fantastic rooftop bar where the views are everything you see in postcards. It was a wonderful stay, and thank you to the staff for being on top of every little detail.. til next time.....!
reviews.title: Terrific hotel all the way around!

reviews.text: I stayed 6 nights late August 2011. The hotel was suitably priced for what it offered though when I was there the bar/restaurant was closed for renovation which was disappointing as so many reviews commented on how popular and lively it was. During my stay, the hotel was dead at night. Their sister hotel, Hotel Continentale, directly opposite, had a very chic roof top bar with incredible views across the city so that was a consolation. Apparently you can also use their gym but I didn't.
reviews.title: Excellent location - bad smell in room though

reviews.text: The BEST thing about this hotel is the location. Being near Ponte Vecchio, the Uffizi and particularly Piazza della Signoria is so much better than staying closer to the cathedral. Palazzo Vecchio is open till 23:00 in summer, plus the draw of Loggia della Signoria (the outdoor statue area), so there is a far greater hive of activity around this part of town. Ponte Vecchio at night had small bands playing music as well. Great vibe!
reviews.title: Luxurious hen weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However…..the room had a bad odour throughout my entire stay - think sewage/old dead rat. I think it was coming through the air con as it came in wafts as well and was not in the bathroom. I told reception but nothing changed and I did not have time to chase it. I have heard before that sewage smells can be common in hotel rooms in Italy and as the air con was directly above the door entry it kind of dissapated by the time it reached my bed (so yes it was unpleasant but I tolerated it as I was out most of the time).
reviews.title: Magnificent boutique hotel in old Florence

reviews.text: I loved this hotel...extremely well located in the heart of Florence, good hotel staff and beautifully decorated. It was certainly worth the cost. I would absolutely stay here again.
reviews.title: LOVED IT!

reviews.text: I stayed here for a week while on a business trip. While our work life was across town at the Exhibition Hall, our night life could not be better. This hotel is located close to all the major sites and wonderful restaurants. The rooms are large by most European standards and the bathroom is huge. A very hard bed, typical of many European establishments, for those of us from the States. The only other negative was there was no reading chair in the room. However, great air conditioning (the front desk controlled but they were very accommodating), good breakfast and a front desk that also seemed to try to help. I would definitely stay here again when I get back to visit.
reviews.title: Great Location and Room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent six nights at the hotel early in June 2011 after reading a review in a trusted American guide that was praiseworthy but went on to describe it as 'very expensive'. Due to the stregth of our AUD$ and the booking of a standard double room (excellent), I would drop the word 'very' and add the description 'outstanding value'. Florence offers a feast of cultural experiences for the traveller and as a consequence is busy and bustling just about all of the time. The hotel is only metres from the Ponte Vecchio but provides an oasis of calm and (relative) quiet both day and night. The bar serves great wines, an outstanding range of cocktails, and is the place to be and be seen. The laid-back music (the choice of a local DJ) is outstanding, perfectly matching the mood of the bar itself. The restaurant served some of the better creative food I have eaten and, despite our best efforts, I would not describe it as 'very expensive'. The hotel is as good as it gets, and is a stylish example of what is exciting about modern Italy.
reviews.title: Relaxing and stylish with great staff. Highly recommended.

reviews.text: Six friends stayed at this hotel in April, 2011. Three of us had single rooms; three stayed in a suite. The hotel was very well-located in a central location near the river, great shops and cafes; we walked to every attraction in Florence. The hotel itself is contemporary; my room was very clean, but quite small, and rather noisy as it was a corner room facing two streets, so street sounds did awaken me. The bathroom in this particular room was rather cramped, and it was difficult to get in and out of the tub/shower; but my friends' rooms and bathrooms were a bit more spacious. The staff was courteous and attentive. The hotel cocktail lounge was wonderful - both the inside and "outside" glassed-in spaces were lovely; great drinks and complimentary bite-sized hors d'oeuvres. All in all, loved the location, reasonable rate, attentive staff. Did not love my room or the contemporary feel which definitely did not reflect any of the charm or character of Florence.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: I travelled to Florence for four days to visit some friends who were currently studying at university there. I chose this hotel because it was recommended to me by a friend, a little bit over my price range, but I decided to give myself a treat and I was not disappointed at all.
reviews.title: right where you want to be

reviews.text: I was a bit hesitant in choosing this hotel in view of the rather mixed reviews on TripAdvisor. However, I'm quite happy to say that the overall experience was quite satisfactory, though there could be areas for improvement of course.
reviews.title: Sophisticated Hotel in the heart of Beautiful Firenze
Great Stay
reviews.text: First, the location - perfectly situated just next to the Ponte Vecchio and within a quiet almost cul-de-sac. No parking at the hotel so if you drive, be prepared to have your car parked in a garage which you can recall for anytime. The current fee is 38 Euros per day.

The hotel is essentially a boutique hotel, created by the Ferragamo family. They also own and operate the rest of the hotels under the Lugarno brand. I visited one of the other hotels which is just across the road from the Gallery Hotel Art - Continentele. Both have similar styles and fittings and furnishings in the rooms. Essentially very modern and comfortable, with high quality materials and of course Ferragamo toiletries, beddings and towels. Flat screen TV was large. If you stay on the top floor, you may get a lovely view of the top of the Duomo or the City Hall Tower. Both are beautiful at night.
reviews.title: Time to find a new Firenze hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A disappointing bit is that none of the rooms have Wifi Internet access. So if you want Wifi, you need to use it in the lobby area.
reviews.title: Good hotel, perfect location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was reasonably good, though the selection of food was limited.
reviews.title: Great rooms, lousy music choices

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was right next to Ponte Vecchio but still in a little alleyway that manages to keep cool and quiet. The room was tasteful though small. The staff very helpful even during high season. You need to leave your car keys with them so thy take it to a garage far away, so bear in mind you need at least 30 min before you get it back once you ask for. They share a cocktail bar roof terrace with their sister hotel right in front that is really worth a visit at sunset.
reviews.title: Excellent location stilish and comfortable
What better way to start a Florence trip! Artistic and beautiful!

reviews.text: 1. One of the comfiest beds ever made up for the tiny rooms ... but in the compact space, great storage, great comfort, nice products, modern amenities, and a cozy feel.
reviews.title: Central location.
Great Place

3. PERFECT location right off the Arno River. A hop, skip, and jump to the main piazzas and museums.
reviews.title: Stunning hotel, best location
